titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Washington Family Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Janet Elaine Gertz

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 27, 2019 at 07:00

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection contains correspondence and other papers of President George Washington, Martha Dandridge Washington, and William Augustine Washington, half brother of George Washington.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Washington Family Papers (MS 538). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of various donors between 1929 and 1948.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Washington Family Papers consists of correspondence and other papers of George Washington and various members of his family, in particular Martha (Dandridge) Washington and William Augustine Washington, half-brother of George. Letters from Alexander Hamilton, Nathaniel Greene, and George Clinton are also included. The bulk of the material relates to George and Martha Washington. As well as correspondence there are military papers and personal financial papers. Most of these items are photostatic copies or facsimiles; the few originals have been removed in the interests of security.
Other materials included in the papers are a number of ledgers belonging to William Augustine Washington and others, and several engraved portraits of George Washington dating from the 1800s.
These papers were given to Yale University by various donors over the period 1929 to 1948.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

did.unittitle: Account of sales in the estate of his mother-in-law, Anne (Ayelett) Washington (Mrs. Augustus, Jr.)
Beverley, Robert, Jr.: Ledger of personal and farm accounts, "Blandfield," Essex County, Virginia
Clinton, George (1739-1812): Draft letter to George Washington
Greene, Nathaniel (1742-1786): ALS to his wife
Harper, Robert Goodloe (1765-1825): ALS to Oliver Wolcott
Trumbull, Jonathan, Jr. (1740-1809): Discharge papers of Isaac Wilsey and Brister Baker; signed also by George Washington
ALS to the Secret Committee of the New York legislature
ALS to Andrew Ward; ALS from Alexander Hamilton to Ward on verso
ALS to George Clinton; draft reply from Clinton on verso
Facsimile to commander of French fleet
ALS to the Grand Lodge of Pennsylvania (facsimile)
Survey map made in Frederick County, Virginia
Memorandum re: ownership of land known as "Northern Neck;" valuation of this land by jurors on verso
"Plan of manoevres to be executed before Maj-Genl Gates at West Point" (not by G. W.)
Discharge papers of Isaac Wilsey and Brister Baker; signed also by Jonathan Trumbull, Jr.
Notes: "From Post Vincennes to the Mouth of the Wabash,"
Notes concerning a farm; AN from Alexander Hamilton on verso
Certificate of appointment of Solomon Porter as inspector of revenue, Hartford
Memorandum re: Secretary at War Wilkenson
"Sundries Bought on Account of A. W.,"
"Memorandum of Stock in the banks of Alexandria and Columbia,"
Printed matter: Engraved portraits, with texts of Washington's Farewell Address and the Declaration of Independence
ALS to a member of the family of Nathaniel Greene
Ledger of personal and farm accounts
"Memorandum Book, containing notes & memorandums of his Transactions for the Estate of Colo. Thomas Turner,"
"Index to Ledger B," estate of Thomas Turner
"Accts & Transactions of the Executors [W. A. Washington and Burdett Ashton] of Richard Henry Lee, decd,"
Inventory and record of the settlement of the estate of W. A. Washington, by Robert Beverley, Jr.
